column1: Ecuador earned a 2-0 win against Qatar in the opening match of the 2022 World Cup at the Al Bayt Stadium. Enner Valencia had a header disallowed for offside by VAR in the third minute
column2: but he soon made up for it by scoring from the penalty spot after being fouled by Saad Al Sheeb. Valencia then doubled his side's lead with a powerful header from Angel Preciado's cross. Qatar had a chance to get back into the game before halftime
column3: but Almoez Ali's header went wide. Ecuador held on in the second half to secure the win and three points in Group A.
